doc.field:
Typescripts of letters said by the donor to have been written by Wynona Boober (no names of the correspondents are on the document). The letters are an daily account of Boober's visit to New York City from December 24, 1940 (Christmas Eve) to January 10, 1941. Boober describes going to museums, theatre, movies, window shopping, restaurants, and Rockefeller Center. She stayed at the Hotel Taft where, traveling as a single woman, at least two men attempted to engage socially with her.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Wynona Boober Typescript Letters

Boober describes going to museums, theatre, movies, window shopping, restaurants, and Rockefeller Center. She stayed at the Hotel Taft where, traveling as a single woman, at least two men attempted to engage socially with her.
